00017 package WeBWorK::DB;
00018 
00019 =head1 NAME
00020 
00021 WeBWorK::DB - interface with the WeBWorK databases.
00022 
00023 =head1 SYNOPSIS
00024 
00025  my $db = WeBWorK::DB->new($dbLayout);
00026  
00027  my @userIDs = $db->listUsers();
00028  my $Sam = $db->{user}->{record}->new();
00029  
00030  $Sam->user_id("sammy");
00031  $Sam->first_name("Sam");
00032  $Sam->last_name("Hathaway");
00033  # etc.
00034  
00035  $db->addUser($User);
00036  my $Dennis = $db->getUser("dennis");
00037  $Dennis->status("C");
00038  $db->putUser->($Dennis);
00039  
00040  $db->deleteUser("sammy");
00041 
00042 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00043 
00044 WeBWorK::DB provides a consistent interface to a number of database backends.
00045 Access and modification functions are provided for each logical table used by
00046 the webwork system. The particular backend ("schema" and "driver"), record
00047 class, data source, and additional parameters are specified by the hash
00048 referenced by C<$dbLayout>, usually taken from the course environment.
00049 
00050 =head1 ARCHITECTURE
00051 
00052 The new database system uses a three-tier architecture to insulate each layer
00053 from the adjacent layers.
00054 
00055 =head2 Top Layer: DB
00056 
00057 The top layer of the architecture is the DB module. It provides the methods
00058 listed below, and uses schema modules (via tables) to implement those methods.
00059 
00060          / new* list* exists* add* get* get*s put* delete* \          <- api
00061  +------------------------------------------------------------------+
00062  |                                DB                                |
00063  +------------------------------------------------------------------+
00064   \ password permission key user set set_user problem problem_user /  <- tables
00065 
00066 =head2 Middle Layer: Schemas
00067 
00068 The middle layer of the architecture is provided by one or more schema modules.
00069 They are called "schema" modules because they control the structure of the data
00070 for a table.
00071 
00072 The schema modules provide an API that matches the requirements of the DB
00073 layer, on a per-table basis. Each schema module has a style that determines
00074 which drivers it can interface with. For example, SQL is an "dbi" style
00075 schema.
00076 
00077 =head2 Bottom Layer: Drivers
00078 
00079 Driver modules implement a style for a schema. They provide physical access to
00080 a data source containing the data for a table. The style of a driver determines
00081 what methods it provides. All drivers provide C<connect(MODE)> and
00082 C<disconnect()> methods. A dbi style driver provides a C<handle()> method which
00083 returns the DBI handle.
00084 
00085 =head2 Record Types
00086 
00087 In C<%dblayout>, each table is assigned a record class, used for passing
00088 complete records to and from the database. The default record classes are
00089 subclasses of the WeBWorK::DB::Record class, and are named as follows: User,
00090 Password, PermissionLevel, Key, Set, UserSet, Problem, UserProblem. In the
00091 following documentation, a reference the the record class for a table means the
00092 record class currently defined for that table in C<%dbLayout>.
00093 
00094 =cut
00095 
00096 use strict;
00097 use warnings;
00098 use Carp;
00099 use Data::Dumper;
00100 use Scalar::Util qw/blessed/;
00101 use WeBWorK::DB::Schema;
00102 use WeBWorK::DB::Utils qw/make_vsetID grok_vsetID grok_setID_from_vsetID_sql
00103     grok_versionID_from_vsetID_sql/;
00104 use WeBWorK::Debug;
00105 use WeBWorK::Utils qw(runtime_use);
00106 
00107 =for comment
00108 
00109 These exceptions will replace the ones in WeBWorK::DB::Schema and will be
00110 allowed to propagate out to calling code. The following callers will have to be
00111 changed to catch these exceptions instead of doing string matching:
00112 
00113 lib/WebworkSOAP.pm:     if ($@ =~ m/user set exists/) {
00114 lib/WeBWorK/ContentGenerator/Instructor.pm:             if ($@ =~ m/user set exists/) {
00115 lib/WeBWorK/ContentGenerator/Instructor.pm:     if ( $@ =~ m/user set exists/ ) {
00116 lib/WeBWorK/ContentGenerator/Instructor.pm:             if ($@ =~ m/user problem exists/) {
00117 lib/WeBWorK/ContentGenerator/Instructor.pm:             if ($@ =~ m/user problem exists/) {
00118 lib/WeBWorK/ContentGenerator/Instructor.pm:                     next if $@ =~ m/user set exists/;
00119 lib/WeBWorK/Utils/DBImportExport.pm:                            if ($@ =~ m/exists/) {
00120 lib/WeBWorK/DB.pm:                              if ($@ and $@ !~ m/password exists/) {
00121 lib/WeBWorK/DB.pm:                              if ($@ and $@ !~ m/permission level exists/) {
00122 
00123 How these exceptions should be used:
00124 
00125 * RecordExists is thrown by the DBI error handler (handle_error in
00126 Schema::NewSQL::Std) when in INSERT fails because a record exists. Thus it can
00127 be thrown via addUser, addPassword, etc.
00128 
00129 * RecordNotFound should be thrown when we try to UPDATE and zero rows were
00130 affected. Problem: Frank Wolfs (UofR PAS) may have a MySQL server that returns 0
00131 when updating even when a record was modified. What's up with that? There's some
00132 question as to where we should throw this: in this file's put* methods? In
00133 Std.pm's put method? Or in update_fields and update_fields_i?
00134 
00135 * DependencyNotFound should be throws when we check for a record that is needed
00136 to insert another record (e.g. password depends on user). These checks are done
00137 in this file, so we'll throw this exception from there.
00138 
00139 =cut
00140 
00141 use Exception::Class (
00142     'WeBWorK::DB::Ex' => {
00143         description => 'unknown database error',
00144     },
00145     'WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordExists' => {
00146         isa => 'WeBWorK::DB::Ex',
00147         fields => ['type', 'key'],
00148         description =>"record exists"
00149     },
00150     'WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordNotFound' => {
00151         isa => 'WeBWorK::DB::Ex',
00152         fields => ['type', 'key'],
00153         description =>"record not found"
00154     },
00155     'WeBWorK::DB::Ex::DependencyNotFound' => {
00156         isa => 'WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordNotFound',
00157     },
00158     'WeBWorK::DB::Ex::TableMissing' => {
00159         isa => 'WeBWorK::DB::Ex',
00160         description =>"missing table",
00161     },
00162 );

00164 ################################################################################
00165 # constructor
00166 ################################################################################
00167 
00168 =head1 CONSTRUCTOR
00169 
00170 =over
00171 
00172 =item new($dbLayout)
00173 
00174 The C<new> method creates a DB object and brings up the underlying schema/driver
00175 structure according to the hash referenced by C<$dbLayout>.
00176 
00177 =back
00178 
00179 =head2 C<$dbLayout> Format
00180 
00181 C<$dbLayout> is a hash reference consisting of items keyed by table names. The
00182 value of each item is a reference to a hash containing the following items:
00183 
00184 =over
00185 
00186 =item record
00187 
00188 The name of a perl module to use for representing the data in a record.
00189 
00190 =item schema
00191 
00192 The name of a perl module to use for access to the table.
00193 
00194 =item driver
00195 
00196 The name of a perl module to use for access to the data source.
00197 
00198 =item source
00199 
00200 The location of the data source that should be used by the driver module.
00201 Depending on the driver, this may be a path, a url, or a DBI spec.
00202 
00203 =item params
00204 
00205 A reference to a hash containing extra information needed by the schema. Some
00206 schemas require parameters, some do not. Consult the documentation for the
00207 schema in question.
00208 
00209 =back
00210 
00211 For each table defined in C<$dbLayout>, C<new> loads the record, schema, and
00212 driver modules. It the schema module's C<tables> method lists the current table
00213 (or contains the string "*") and the output of the schema and driver modules'
00214 C<style> methods match, the table is installed. Otherwise, an exception is
00215 thrown.
00216 
00217 =cut
00218 
00219 sub new {
00220     my ($invocant, $dbLayout) = @_;
00221     my $class = ref($invocant) || $invocant;
00222     my $self = {};
00223     bless $self, $class; # bless this here so we can pass it to the schema
00224     
00225     # load the modules required to handle each table, and create driver
00226     foreach my $table (keys %$dbLayout) {
00227         $self->init_table($dbLayout, $table);
00228     }
00229     
00230     return $self;
00231 }
00232 
00233 sub init_table {
00234     my ($self, $dbLayout, $table) = @_;
00235     
00236     if (exists $self->{$table}) {
00237         if (defined $self->{$table}) {
00238             return;
00239         } else {
00240             die "loop in dbLayout table dependencies involving table '$table'\n";
00241         }
00242     }
00243     
00244     my $layout = $dbLayout->{$table};
00245     my $record = $layout->{record};
00246     my $schema = $layout->{schema};
00247     my $driver = $layout->{driver};
00248     my $source = $layout->{source};
00249     my $depend = $layout->{depend};
00250     my $params = $layout->{params};
00251     
00252     # add a key for this table to the self hash, but don't define it yet
00253     # this for loop detection
00254     $self->{$table} = undef;
00255     
00256     if ($depend) {
00257         foreach my $dep (@$depend) {
00258             $self->init_table($dbLayout, $dep);
00259         }
00260     }
00261     
00262     runtime_use($record);
00263     
00264     runtime_use($driver);
00265     my $driverObject = eval { $driver->new($source, $params) };
00266     croak "error instantiating DB driver $driver for table $table: $@"
00267         if $@;
00268     
00269     runtime_use($schema);
00270     my $schemaObject = eval { $schema->new(
00271         $self, $driverObject, $table, $record, $params) };
00272     croak "error instantiating DB schema $schema for table $table: $@"
00273         if $@;
00274     
00275     $self->{$table} = $schemaObject;
00276 }

00282 sub gen_schema_accessor {
00283     my $schema = shift;
00284     return sub { shift->{$schema} };
00285 }
00286 
00287 sub gen_new {
00288     my $table = shift;
00289     return sub { shift->{$table}{record}->new(@_) };
00290 }
00291 
00292 sub gen_count_where {
00293     my $table = shift;
00294     return sub {
00295         my ($self, $where) = @_;
00296         return $self->{$table}->count_where($where);
00297     };
00298 }
00299 
00300 sub gen_exists_where {
00301     my $table = shift;
00302     return sub {
00303         my ($self, $where) = @_;
00304         return $self->{$table}->exists_where($where);
00305     };
00306 }
00307 
00308 sub gen_list_where {
00309     my $table = shift;
00310     return sub {
00311         my ($self, $where, $order) = @_;
00312         if (wantarray) {
00313             return $self->{$table}->list_where($where, $order);
00314         } else {
00315             return $self->{$table}->list_where_i($where, $order);
00316         }
00317     };
00318 }
00319 
00320 sub gen_get_records_where {
00321     my $table = shift;
00322     return sub {
00323         my ($self, $where, $order) = @_;
00324         if (wantarray) {
00325             return $self->{$table}->get_records_where($where, $order);
00326         } else {
00327             return $self->{$table}->get_records_where_i($where, $order);
00328         }
00329     };
00330 }
00331 
00332 sub gen_insert_records {
00333     my $table = shift;
00334     return sub {
00335         my ($self, @records) = @_;
00336         if (@records == 1 and blessed $records[0] and $records[0]->isa("Iterator")) {
00337             return $self->{$table}->insert_records_i($records[0]);
00338         } else {
00339             return $self->{$table}->insert_records(@records);
00340         }
00341     };
00342 }
00343 
00344 sub gen_update_records {
00345     my $table = shift;
00346     return sub {
00347         my ($self, @records) = @_;
00348         if (@records == 1 and blessed $records[0] and $records[0]->isa("Iterator")) {
00349             return $self->{$table}->update_records_i($records[0]);
00350         } else {
00351             return $self->{$table}->update_records(@records);
00352         }
00353     };
00354 }
00355 
00356 sub gen_delete_where {
00357     my $table = shift;
00358     return sub {
00359         my ($self, $where) = @_;
00360         return $self->{$table}->delete_where($where);
00361     };
00362 }

00364 ################################################################################
00365 # create/rename/delete/dump/restore tables

00367 
00368 sub create_tables {
00369     my ($self) = @_;
00370     
00371     foreach my $table (keys %$self) {
00372         next if $table =~ /^_/; # skip non-table self fields (none yet)
00373         next if $self->{$table}{params}{non_native}; # skip non-native tables
00374         my $schema_obj = $self->{$table};
00375         if ($schema_obj->can("create_table")) {
00376             $schema_obj->create_table;
00377         } else {
00378             warn "skipping creation of '$table' table: no create_table method\n";
00379         }
00380     }
00381     
00382     return 1;
00383 }
00384 
00385 sub rename_tables {
00386     my ($self, $new_dblayout) = @_;
00387     
00388     foreach my $table (keys %$self) {
00389         next if $table =~ /^_/; # skip non-table self fields (none yet)
00390         next if $self->{$table}{params}{non_native}; # skip non-native tables
00391         my $schema_obj = $self->{$table};
00392         if (exists $new_dblayout->{$table}) {
00393             if ($schema_obj->can("rename_table")) {
00394                 # we look into the new dblayout to determine the new table names
00395                 my $new_sql_table_name = defined $new_dblayout->{$table}{params}{tableOverride}
00396                     ? $new_dblayout->{$table}{params}{tableOverride}
00397                     : $table;
00398                 $schema_obj->rename_table($new_sql_table_name);
00399             } else {
00400                 warn "skipping renaming of '$table' table: no rename_table method\n";
00401             }
00402         } else {
00403             warn "skipping renaming of '$table' table: table doesn't exist in new dbLayout\n";
00404         }
00405     }
00406     
00407     return 1;
00408 }
00409 
00410 sub delete_tables {
00411     my ($self) = @_;
00412     
00413     foreach my $table (keys %$self) {
00414         next if $table =~ /^_/; # skip non-table self fields (none yet)
00415         next if $self->{$table}{params}{non_native}; # skip non-native tables
00416         my $schema_obj = $self->{$table};
00417         if ($schema_obj->can("delete_table")) {
00418             $schema_obj->delete_table;
00419         } else {
00420             warn "skipping deletion of '$table' table: no delete_table method\n";
00421         }
00422     }
00423     
00424     return 1;
00425 }
00426 
00427 sub dump_tables {
00428     my ($self, $dump_dir) = @_;
00429     
00430     foreach my $table (keys %$self) {
00431         next if $table =~ /^_/; # skip non-table self fields (none yet)
00432         next if $self->{$table}{params}{non_native}; # skip non-native tables
00433         my $schema_obj = $self->{$table};
00434         if ($schema_obj->can("dump_table")) {
00435             my $dump_file = "$dump_dir/$table.sql";
00436             $schema_obj->dump_table($dump_file);
00437         } else {
00438             warn "skipping dump of '$table' table: no dump_table method\n";
00439         }
00440     }
00441     
00442     return 1;
00443 }
00444 
00445 sub restore_tables {
00446     my ($self, $dump_dir) = @_;
00447     
00448     foreach my $table (keys %$self) {
00449         next if $table =~ /^_/; # skip non-table self fields (none yet)
00450         next if $self->{$table}{params}{non_native}; # skip non-native tables
00451         my $schema_obj = $self->{$table};
00452         if ($schema_obj->can("restore_table")) {
00453             my $dump_file = "$dump_dir/$table.sql";
00454             $schema_obj->restore_table($dump_file);
00455         } else {
00456             warn "skipping restore of '$table' table: no restore_table method\n";
00457         }
00458     }
00459     
00460     return 1;
00461 }

00467 BEGIN {
00468     *User = gen_schema_accessor("user");
00469     *newUser = gen_new("user");
00470     *countUsersWhere = gen_count_where("user");

00476 sub countUsers { return scalar shift->listUsers(@_) }
00477 
00478 sub listUsers {
00479     my ($self) = shift->checkArgs(\@_);
00480     if (wantarray) {
00481         return map { @$_ } $self->{user}->get_fields_where(["user_id"]);
00482     } else {
00483         return $self->{user}->count_where;
00484     }
00485 }
00486 
00487 sub existsUser {
00488     my ($self, $userID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id/);
00489     return $self->{user}->exists($userID);
00490 }
00491 
00492 sub getUser {
00493     my ($self, $userID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id/);
00494     return ( $self->getUsers($userID) )[0];
00495 }
00496 
00497 sub getUsers {
00498     my ($self, @userIDs) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id*/);
00499     return $self->{user}->gets(map { [$_] } @userIDs);
00500 }
00501 
00502 sub addUser {
00503     my ($self, $User) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:user/);
00504     eval {
00505         return $self->{user}->add($User);
00506     };
00507     if (my $ex = caught WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordExists) {
00508         croak "addUser: user exists (perhaps you meant to use putUser?)";
00509     } elsif ($@) {
00510         die $@;
00511     }
00512     # FIXME about these exceptions: eventually the exceptions should be part of
00513     # WeBWorK::DB rather than WeBWorK::DB::Schema, and we should just let them
00514     # through to the calling code. however, right now we have code that checks
00515     # for the string "... exists" in the error message, so we need to convert
00516     # here.
00517     # 
00518     # WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordExists
00519     # WeBWorK::DB::Ex::DependencyNotFound - i.e. inserting a password for a nonexistent user
00520     # ?
00521 }
00522 
00523 sub putUser {
00524     my ($self, $User) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:user/);
00525     my $rows = $self->{user}->put($User); # DBI returns 0E0 for 0.
00526     if ($rows == 0) {
00527         croak "putUser: user not found (perhaps you meant to use addUser?)";
00528     } else {
00529         return $rows;
00530     }
00531 }
00532 
00533 sub deleteUser {
00534     my ($self, $userID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id/);
00535     $self->deleteUserSet($userID, undef);
00536     $self->deletePassword($userID);
00537     $self->deletePermissionLevel($userID);
00538     $self->deleteKey($userID);
00539     return $self->{user}->delete($userID);
00540 }

00552     *getPasswordsWhere = gen_get_records_where("password");

00555 sub countPasswords { return scalar shift->countPasswords(@_) }
00556 
00557 sub listPasswords {
00558     my ($self) = shift->checkArgs(\@_);
00559     if (wantarray) {
00560         return map { @$_ } $self->{password}->get_fields_where(["user_id"]);
00561     } else {
00562         return $self->{password}->count_where;
00563     }
00564 }
00565 
00566 sub existsPassword {
00567     my ($self, $userID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id/);
00568     # FIXME should we claim that a password exists if the user exists, since
00569     # password records are auto-created?
00570     return $self->{password}->exists($userID);
00571 }
00572 
00573 sub getPassword {
00574     my ($self, $userID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id/);
00575     return ( $self->getPasswords($userID) )[0];
00576 }
00577 
00578 sub getPasswords {
00579     my ($self, @userIDs) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id*/);
00580     
00581     my @Passwords = $self->{password}->gets(map { [$_] } @userIDs);
00582     
00583     # AUTO-CREATE missing password records
00584     # (this code is duplicated in getPermissionLevels, below)
00585     for (my $i = 0; $i < @Passwords; $i++) {
00586         my $Password = $Passwords[$i];
00587         my $userID = $userIDs[$i];
00588         if (not defined $Password) {
00589             if ($self->{user}->exists($userID)) {
00590                 $Password = $self->newPassword(user_id => $userID);
00591                 eval { $self->addPassword($Password) };
00592                 if ($@ and $@ !~ m/password exists/) {
00593                     die "error while auto-creating password record for user $userID: $@";
00594                 }
00595                 $Passwords[$i] = $Password;
00596             }
00597         }
00598     }
00599     
00600     return @Passwords;
00601 }
00602 
00603 sub addPassword {
00604     my ($self, $Password) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:password/);
00605     
00606     croak "addPassword: user ", $Password->user_id, " not found"
00607         unless $self->{user}->exists($Password->user_id);
00608     
00609     eval {
00610         return $self->{password}->add($Password);
00611     };
00612     if (my $ex = caught WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordExists) {
00613         croak "addPassword: password exists (perhaps you meant to use putPassword?)";
00614     } elsif ($@) {
00615         die $@;
00616     }
00617 }
00618 
00619 sub putPassword {
00620     my ($self, $Password) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:password/);
00621     my $rows = $self->{password}->put($Password); # DBI returns 0E0 for 0.
00622     if ($rows == 0) {
00623         # AUTO-CREATE permission level records
00624         return $self->addPassword($Password);
00625     } else {
00626         return $rows;
00627     }
00628 }
00629 
00630 sub deletePassword {
00631     my ($self, $userID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id/);
00632     return $self->{password}->delete($userID);
00633 }

00635 ################################################################################
00636 # permission functions
00637 ################################################################################
00638 
00639 BEGIN {
00640     *PermissionLevel = gen_schema_accessor("permission");
00641     *newPermissionLevel = gen_new("permission");
00642     *countPermissionLevelsWhere = gen_count_where("permission");
00643     *existsPermissionLevelWhere = gen_exists_where("permission");
00644     *listPermissionLevelsWhere = gen_list_where("permission");
00645     *getPermissionLevelsWhere = gen_get_records_where("permission");
00646 }
00647 
00648 sub countPermissionLevels { return scalar shift->listPermissionLevels(@_) }
00649 
00650 sub listPermissionLevels {
00651     my ($self) = shift->checkArgs(\@_);
00652     if (wantarray) {
00653         return map { @$_ } $self->{permission}->get_fields_where(["user_id"]);
00654     } else {
00655         return $self->{permission}->count_where;
00656     }
00657 }
00658 
00659 sub existsPermissionLevel {
00660     my ($self, $userID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id/);
00661     # FIXME should we claim that a permission level exists if the user exists,
00662     # since password records are auto-created?
00663     return $self->{permission}->exists($userID);
00664 }
00665 
00666 sub getPermissionLevel {
00667     my ($self, $userID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id/);
00668     return ( $self->getPermissionLevels($userID) )[0];
00669 }
00670 
00671 sub getPermissionLevels {
00672     my ($self, @userIDs) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id*/);
00673     
00674     my @PermissionLevels = $self->{permission}->gets(map { [$_] } @userIDs);
00675     
00676     # AUTO-CREATE missing permission level records
00677     # (this code is duplicated in getPasswords, above)
00678     for (my $i = 0; $i < @PermissionLevels; $i++) {
00679         my $PermissionLevel = $PermissionLevels[$i];
00680         my $userID = $userIDs[$i];
00681         if (not defined $PermissionLevel) {
00682             if ($self->{user}->exists($userID)) {
00683                 $PermissionLevel = $self->newPermissionLevel(user_id => $userID);
00684                 eval { $self->addPermissionLevel($PermissionLevel) };
00685                 if ($@ and $@ !~ m/permission level exists/) {
00686                     die "error while auto-creating permission level record for user $userID: $@";
00687                 }
00688                 $PermissionLevels[$i] = $PermissionLevel;
00689             }
00690         }
00691     }
00692     
00693     return @PermissionLevels;
00694 }
00695 
00696 sub addPermissionLevel {
00697     my ($self, $PermissionLevel) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:permission/);
00698     
00699     croak "addPermissionLevel: user ", $PermissionLevel->user_id, " not found"
00700         unless $self->{user}->exists($PermissionLevel->user_id);
00701     
00702     eval {
00703         return $self->{permission}->add($PermissionLevel);
00704     };
00705     if (my $ex = caught WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordExists) {
00706         croak "addPermissionLevel: permission level exists (perhaps you meant to use putPermissionLevel?)";
00707     } elsif ($@) {
00708         die $@;
00709     }
00710 }
00711 
00712 sub putPermissionLevel {
00713     my ($self, $PermissionLevel) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:permission/);
00714     my $rows = $self->{permission}->put($PermissionLevel); # DBI returns 0E0 for 0.
00715     if ($rows == 0) {
00716         # AUTO-CREATE permission level records
00717         return $self->addPermissionLevel($PermissionLevel);
00718     } else {
00719         return $rows;
00720     }
00721 }
00722 
00723 sub deletePermissionLevel {
00724     my ($self, $userID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id/);
00725     return $self->{permission}->delete($userID);
00726 }

00729 # key functions

00732 BEGIN {
00733     *Key = gen_schema_accessor("key");
00734     *newKey = gen_new("key");
00735     *countKeysWhere = gen_count_where("key");

00737     *listKeysWhere = gen_list_where("key");
00738     *getKeysWhere = gen_get_records_where("key");
00739 }

00741 sub countKeys { return scalar shift->listKeys(@_) }
00742 
00743 sub listKeys {
00744     my ($self) = shift->checkArgs(\@_);
00745     if (wantarray) {
00746         return map { @$_ } $self->{key}->get_fields_where(["user_id"]);
00747     } else {
00748         return $self->{key}->count_where;
00749     }
00750 }
00751 
00752 sub existsKey {
00753     my ($self, $userID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id/);
00754     return $self->{key}->exists($userID);
00755 }
00756 
00757 sub getKey {
00758     my ($self, $userID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id/);
00759     return ( $self->getKeys($userID) )[0];
00760 }
00761 
00762 sub getKeys {
00763     my ($self, @userIDs) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id*/);
00764     return $self->{key}->gets(map { [$_] } @userIDs);
00765 }
00766 
00767 sub addKey {
00768     # PROCTORING - allow comma in keyfields
00769     my ($self, $Key) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/VREC:key/);
00770     
00771     # PROCTORING -  check for both user and proctor
00772     # we allow for two entries for proctor keys, one of the form 
00773     #    userid,proctorid (which authorizes login), and the other 
00774     #    of the form userid,proctorid,g (which authorizes grading)
00775     # (having two of these means that a proctored test will require 
00776     #    authorization for both login and grading).
00777     if ($Key->user_id =~ /([^,]+)(?:,([^,]*))?(,g)?/) {
00778         my ($userID, $proctorID) = ($1, $2);
00779         croak "addKey: user $userID not found"
00780             unless $self->{user}->exists($userID);
00781         croak "addKey: proctor $proctorID not found"
00782             unless $self->{user}->exists($proctorID);
00783     } else {
00784         croak "addKey: user ", $Key->user_id, " not found"
00785             unless $self->{user}->exists($Key->user_id);
00786     }
00787     
00788     eval {
00789         return $self->{key}->add($Key);
00790     };
00791     if (my $ex = caught WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordExists) {
00792         croak "addKey: key exists (perhaps you meant to use putKey?)";
00793     } elsif ($@) {
00794         die $@;
00795     }
00796 }
00797 
00798 sub putKey {
00799     # PROCTORING - allow comma in keyfields
00800     my ($self, $Key) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/VREC:key/);
00801     my $rows = $self->{key}->put($Key); # DBI returns 0E0 for 0.
00802     if ($rows == 0) {
00803         croak "putKey: key not found (perhaps you meant to use addKey?)";
00804     } else {
00805         return $rows;
00806     }
00807 }
00808 
00809 sub deleteKey {
00810     my ($self, $userID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id/);
00811     return $self->{key}->delete($userID);
00812 }
00813 
00814 sub deleteAllProctorKeys {
00815     my ($self, $userID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id/);
00816     my $where = [user_id_like => "$userID,%"];
00817 
00818     return $self->{key}->delete_where($where);
00819 }

00821 ################################################################################
00822 # setting functions
00823 ################################################################################
00824 
00825 BEGIN {
00826     *Setting = gen_schema_accessor("setting");
00827     *newSetting = gen_new("setting");
00828     *countSettingsWhere = gen_count_where("setting");
00829     *existsSettingWhere = gen_exists_where("setting");
00830     *listSettingsWhere = gen_list_where("setting");
00831     *getSettingsWhere = gen_get_records_where("setting");
00832     *addSettings = gen_insert_records("setting");
00833     *putSettings = gen_update_records("setting");
00834     *deleteSettingsWhere = gen_delete_where("setting");
00835 }
00836 
00837 # minimal set of routines for basic setting operation
00838 # we don't need a full set, since the usage of settings is somewhat limited
00839 # we also don't want to bother with records, since a setting is just a pair
00840 
00841 sub settingExists {
00842     my ($self, $name) = @_;
00843     return $self->{setting}->exists_where([name_eq=>$name]);
00844 }
00845 
00846 sub getSettingValue {
00847     my ($self, $name) = @_;
00848     return map { @$_ } $self->{setting}->get_fields_where(['value'], [name_eq=>$name]);
00849 }
00850 
00851 # we totally don't care if a setting already exists (and in fact i find that
00852 # whole distinction somewhat annoying lately) so we hide the fact that we're
00853 # either calling insert or update. at some point we could stand to add a
00854 # method to Std.pm that used REPLACE INTO and then we'd be able to not care
00855 # at all whether a setting was already there
00856 sub setSettingValue {
00857     my ($self, $name, $value) = @_;
00858     if ($self->settingExists($name)) {
00859         return $self->{setting}->update_where({value=>$value}, [name_eq=>$name]);
00860     } else {
00861         return $self->{setting}->insert_fields(['name','value'], [[$name,$value]]);
00862     }
00863 }
00864 
00865 sub deleteSetting {
00866     my ($self, $name) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/name/);
00867     return $self->{setting}->delete_where([name_eq=>$name]);
00868 }

00870 ################################################################################
00871 # locations functions
00872 ################################################################################
00873 # this database table is for ip restrictions by assignment
00874 # the locations table defines names of locations consisting of 
00875 #    lists of ip masks (found in the location_addresses table)
00876 #    to which assignments can be restricted to or denied from.
00877 
00878 BEGIN { 
00879     *Location = gen_schema_accessor("locations");
00880     *newLocation = gen_new("locations");
00881     *countLocationsWhere = gen_count_where("locations");
00882     *existsLocationWhere = gen_exists_where("locations");
00883     *listLocationsWhere = gen_list_where("locations");
00884     *getLocationsWhere = gen_get_records_where("locations");
00885 }
00886 
00887 sub countLocations { return scalar shift->listLocations(@_) }
00888 
00889 sub listLocations {
00890     my ( $self ) = shift->checkArgs(\@_);
00891     if ( wantarray ) {
00892         return map {@$_} $self->{locations}->get_fields_where(["location_id"]);
00893     } else {
00894         return $self->{locations}->count_where;
00895     }
00896 }
00897 
00898 sub existsLocation { 
00899     my ( $self, $locationID ) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/location_id/);
00900     return $self->{locations}->exists($locationID);
00901 }
00902 
00903 sub getLocation { 
00904     my ( $self, $locationID ) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/location_id/);
00905     return ( $self->getLocations($locationID) )[0];
00906 }
00907 
00908 sub getLocations {
00909     my ( $self, @locationIDs ) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/location_id*/);
00910     return $self->{locations}->gets(map {[$_]} @locationIDs);
00911 }
00912 
00913 sub getAllLocations { 
00914     my ( $self ) = shift->checkArgs(\@_);
00915     return $self->{locations}->get_records_where();
00916 }
00917 
00918 sub addLocation { 
00919     my ( $self, $Location ) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:locations/);
00920 
00921     eval {
00922         return $self->{locations}->add($Location);
00923     };
00924     if ( my $ex = caught WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordExists ) {
00925         croak "addLocation: location exists (perhaps you meant to use putLocation?)";
00926     } elsif ($@) {
00927         die $@;
00928     }
00929 }
00930 
00931 sub putLocation { 
00932     my ($self, $Location) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:locations/);
00933     my $rows = $self->{locations}->put($Location);
00934     if ( $rows == 0 ) {
00935         croak "putLocation: location not found (perhaps you meant to use addLocation?)";
00936     } else {
00937         return $rows;
00938     }
00939 }
00940 
00941 sub deleteLocation {
00942     # do we need to allow calls from this package?  I can't think of
00943     #    any case where that would happen, but we include it for other
00944     #    deletions, so I'll keep it here.
00945     my $U = caller eq __PACKAGE__ ? "!" : "";
00946     my ( $self, $locationID ) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, "location_id$U");
00947     $self->deleteGlobalSetLocation(undef, $locationID);
00948     $self->deleteUserSetLocation(undef, undef, $locationID);
00949 
00950     # NOTE: the one piece of this that we don't address is if this 
00951     #    results in all of the locations in a set's restriction being
00952     #    cleared; in this case, we should probably also reset the 
00953     #    set->restrict_ip setting as well.  but that requires going 
00954     #    out and doing a bunch of manipulations that well exceed what
00955     #    we want to do in this routine, so we'll assume that the user
00956     #    is smart enough to deal with that on her own.
00957 
00958     # addresses in the location_addresses table also need to be cleared
00959     $self->deleteLocationAddress($locationID, undef);
00960 
00961     return $self->{locations}->delete($locationID);
00962 }
00963

00997     if ( wantarray ) { 
00998         return map {@$_} $self->{location_addresses}->get_fields_where(["ip_mask"],$where);
00999     } else {
01000         return $self->{location_addresses}->count_where($where);
01001     }
01002 }

01018 sub addLocationAddress { 
01019     my ($self, $LocationAddress) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:location_addresses/);
01020     croak "addLocationAddress: location ", $LocationAddress->location_id, " not found" 
01021         unless $self->{locations}->exists($LocationAddress->location_id);
01022     eval {
01023         return $self->{location_addresses}->add($LocationAddress);
01024     };
01025     if (my $ex = caught WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordExists) {
01026         croak "addLocationAddress: location address exists (perhaps you meant to use putLocationAddress?)";
01027     } elsif ($@) {
01028         die $@;
01029     }

01037     } else {

01039     }
01040 }

01175 # the code from addUserSet() is duplicated in large part following in 
01176 # addVersionedUserSet; changes here should accordingly be propagated down there
01177 sub addUserSet {
01178     my ($self, $UserSet) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:set_user/);
01179     
01180     croak "addUserSet: user ", $UserSet->user_id, " not found"
01181         unless $self->{user}->exists($UserSet->user_id);
01182     croak "addUserSet: set ", $UserSet->set_id, " not found"
01183         unless $self->{set}->exists($UserSet->set_id);
01184     
01185     eval {
01186         return $self->{set_user}->add($UserSet);
01187     };
01188     if (my $ex = caught WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordExists) {
01189         croak "addUserSet: user set exists (perhaps you meant to use putUserSet?)";
01190     } elsif ($@) {
01191         die $@;
01192     }
01193 }
01194 
01195 # the code from putUserSet() is duplicated in large part in the following
01196 # putVersionedUserSet; c.f. that routine
01197 sub putUserSet {
01198     my ($self, $UserSet) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:set_user/);
01199     my $rows = $self->{set_user}->put($UserSet); # DBI returns 0E0 for 0.
01200     if ($rows == 0) {
01201         croak "putUserSet: user set not found (perhaps you meant to use addUserSet?)";
01202     } else {
01203         return $rows;
01204     }
01205 }
01206 
01207 sub deleteUserSet {
01208     # userID and setID can be undefined if being called from this package
01209     my $U = caller eq __PACKAGE__ ? "!" : "";
01210     my ($self, $userID, $setID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, "user_id$U", "set_id$U");
01211     $self->deleteSetVersion($userID, $setID, undef);
01212     $self->deleteUserProblem($userID, $setID, undef);
01213     return $self->{set_user}->delete($userID, $setID);
01214 }

01220 BEGIN {
01221     *MergedSet = gen_schema_accessor("set_merged");
01222     #*newMergedSet = gen_new("set_merged");

01224     *existsMergedSetWhere = gen_exists_where("set_merged");
01225     #*listMergedSetsWhere = gen_list_where("set_merged");
01226     *getMergedSetsWhere = gen_get_records_where("set_merged");

01229 sub existsMergedSet {
01230     my ($self, $userID, $setID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id set_id/);
01231     return $self->{set_merged}->exists($userID, $setID);
01232 }

01248 BEGIN {

01251     *countSetVersionsWhere = gen_count_where("set_version");
01252     *existsSetVersionWhere = gen_exists_where("set_version");
01253     *listSetVersionsWhere = gen_list_where("set_version");
01254     *getSetVersionsWhere = gen_get_records_where("set_version");

01256 
01257 # versioned analog of countUserSets
01258 sub countSetVersions { return scalar shift->listSetVersions(@_) }
01259 
01260 # versioned analog of listUserSets
01261 sub listSetVersions {
01262     my ($self, $userID, $setID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id set_id/);
01263     my $where = [user_id_eq_set_id_eq => $userID,$setID];
01264     my $order = [ 'version_id' ];
01265     if (wantarray) {
01266         return map { @$_ } $self->{set_version}->get_fields_where(["version_id"], $where, $order);
01267     } else {
01268         return $self->{set_version}->count_where($where);
01269     }
01270 }
01271 
01272 # versioned analog of existsUserSet
01273 sub existsSetVersion {
01274     my ($self, $userID, $setID, $versionID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id set_id version_id/);
01275     return $self->{set_version}->exists($userID, $setID, $versionID);
01276 }
01277 
01278 # versioned analog of getUserSet
01279 sub getSetVersion {
01280     my ($self, $userID, $setID, $versionID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id set_id version_id/);
01281     return ( $self->getSetVersions([$userID, $setID, $versionID]) )[0];
01282 }
01283 
01284 # versioned analog of getUserSets
01285 sub getSetVersions {
01286     my ($self, @setVersionIDs) = shift->checkArgsRefList(\@_, qw/user_id set_id version_id/);
01287     return $self->{set_version}->gets(@setVersionIDs);
01288 }
01289 
01290 # versioned analog of addUserSet
01291 sub addSetVersion {
01292     my ($self, $SetVersion) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:set_version/);
01293     
01294     croak "addSetVersion: set ", $SetVersion->set_id, " not found for user ", $SetVersion->user_id
01295         unless $self->{set_user}->exists($SetVersion->user_id, $SetVersion->set_id);
01296     
01297     eval {
01298         return $self->{set_version}->add($SetVersion);
01299     };
01300     if (my $ex = caught WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordExists) {
01301         croak "addSetVersion: set version exists (perhaps you meant to use putSetVersion?)";
01302     } elsif ($@) {
01303         die $@;
01304     }
01305 }
01306 
01307 # versioned analog of putUserSet
01308 sub putSetVersion {
01309     my ($self, $SetVersion) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:set_version/);
01310     my $rows = $self->{set_version}->put($SetVersion); # DBI returns 0E0 for 0.
01311     if ($rows == 0) {
01312         croak "putSetVersion: set version not found (perhaps you meant to use addSetVersion?)";
01313     } else {
01314         return $rows;
01315     }
01316 }
01317 
01318 # versioned analog of deleteUserSet
01319 sub deleteSetVersion {
01320     # userID, setID, and versionID can be undefined if being called from this package
01321     my $U = caller eq __PACKAGE__ ? "!" : "";
01322     my ($self, $userID, $setID, $versionID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, "user_id$U", "set_id$U", "version_id$U");
01323     $self->deleteProblemVersion($userID, $setID, $versionID, undef);
01324     return $self->{set_version}->delete($userID, $setID, $versionID);
01325 }

01355 ################################################################################
01356 # set_locations functions
01357 ################################################################################
01358 # this database table is for ip restrictions by assignment
01359 # the set_locations table defines the association between a 
01360 #    global set and the locations to which the set may be 
01361 #    restricted or denied.
01362 
01363 BEGIN {
01364     *GlobalSetLocation = gen_schema_accessor("set_locations");
01365     *newGlobalSetLocation = gen_new("set_locations");
01366     *countGlobalSetLocationsWhere = gen_count_where("set_locations");
01367     *existsGlobalSetLocationWhere = gen_exists_where("set_locations");
01368     *listGlobalSetLocationsWhere = gen_list_where("set_locations");
01369     *getGlobalSetLocationsWhere = gen_get_records_where("set_locations");
01370 }
01371 
01372 sub countGlobalSetLocations { return scalar shift->listGlobalSetLocations(@_) }
01373 
01374 sub listGlobalSetLocations {
01375     my ( $self, $setID ) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/set_id/);
01376     my $where = [set_id_eq => $setID];
01377     if ( wantarray ) {
01378         my $order = ['location_id'];
01379         return map { @$_ } $self->{set_locations}->get_fields_where(["location_id"], $where, $order);
01380     } else {
01381         return $self->{set_user}->count_where( $where );
01382     }
01383 }
01384 
01385 sub existsGlobalSetLocation { 
01386     my ( $self, $setID, $locationID ) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/set_id location_id/);
01387     return $self->{set_locations}->exists( $setID, $locationID );
01388 }
01389 
01390 sub getGlobalSetLocation { 
01391     my ( $self, $setID, $locationID ) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/set_id location_id/);
01392     return ( $self->getGlobalSetLocations([$setID, $locationID]) )[0];
01393 }
01394 
01395 sub getGlobalSetLocations {
01396     my ( $self, @locationIDs ) = shift->checkArgsRefList(\@_, qw/set_id location_id/);
01397     return $self->{set_locations}->gets(@locationIDs);
01398 }
01399 
01400 sub getAllGlobalSetLocations {
01401     my ( $self, $setID ) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/set_id/);
01402     my $where = [set_id_eq => $setID];
01403     return $self->{set_locations}->get_records_where( $where );
01404 }
01405 
01406 sub addGlobalSetLocation { 
01407     my ( $self, $GlobalSetLocation ) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:set_locations/);
01408     croak "addGlobalSetLocation: set ", $GlobalSetLocation->set_id, " not found"
01409         unless $self->{set}->exists($GlobalSetLocation->set_id);
01410     
01411     eval {
01412         return $self->{set_locations}->add($GlobalSetLocation);
01413     };
01414     if (my $ex = caught WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordExists) {
01415         croak "addGlobalSetLocation: global set_location exists (perhaps you meant to use putGlobalSetLocation?)";
01416     } elsif ($@) {
01417         die $@;
01418     }
01419 }
01420 
01421 sub putGlobalSetLocation {
01422     my ($self, $GlobalSetLocation) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:set_locations/);
01423     my $rows = $self->{set_locations}->put($GlobalSetLocation); # DBI returns 0E0 for 0.
01424     if ($rows == 0) {
01425         croak "putGlobalSetLocation: global problem not found (perhaps you meant to use addGlobalSetLocation?)";
01426     } else {
01427         return $rows;
01428     }
01429 }
01430 
01431 sub deleteGlobalSetLocation {
01432     # setID and locationID can be undefined if being called from this package
01433     my $U = caller eq __PACKAGE__ ? "!" : "";
01434     my ($self, $setID, $locationID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, "set_id$U", "location_id$U");
01435     $self->deleteUserSetLocation(undef, $setID, $locationID);
01436     return $self->{set_locations}->delete($setID, $locationID);
01437 }

01488     return( $self->getUserSetLocations([$userID, $setID, $locationID]) )[0];
01489 }
01490 
01491 # FIXME: we won't ever use this because all fields are key fields
01492 sub getUserSetLocations {

01494     return $self->{set_locations_user}->gets(@userSetLocationIDs);

01497 sub getAllUserSetLocations {
01498     my ($self, $userID, $setID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id set_id/);
01499     my $where = [user_id_eq_set_id_eq => $userID,$setID];
01500     return $self->{set_locations_user}->get_records_where($where);
01501 }
01502 
01503 sub addUserSetLocation {
01504     # VERSIONING - accept versioned ID fields
01505     my ($self, $UserSetLocation) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/VREC:set_locations_user/);
01506     
01507     croak "addUserSetLocation: user set ", $UserSetLocation->set_id, " for user ", $UserSetLocation->user_id, " not found"
01508         unless $self->{set_user}->exists($UserSetLocation->user_id, $UserSetLocation->set_id);
01509     
01510     eval {
01511         return $self->{set_locations_user}->add($UserSetLocation);
01512     };
01513     if (my $ex = caught WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordExists) {
01514         croak "addUserSetLocation: user set_location exists (perhaps you meant to use putUserSetLocation?)";
01515     } elsif ($@) {
01516         die $@;
01517     }
01518 }
01519 
01520 # FIXME: we won't ever use this because all fields are key fields
01521 # versioned_ok is an optional argument which lets us slip versioned setIDs through checkArgs.
01522 sub putUserSetLocation {
01523     my $V = $_[2] ? "V" : "";
01524     my ($self, $UserSetLocation, undef) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, "${V}REC:set_locations_user", "versioned_ok!?");
01525     
01526     my $rows = $self->{set_locations_user}->put($UserSetLocation); # DBI returns 0E0 for 0.
01527     if ($rows == 0) {
01528         croak "putUserSetLocation: user set location not found (perhaps you meant to use addUserSetLocation?)";
01529     } else {
01530         return $rows;
01531     }
01532 }
01533 
01534 sub deleteUserSetLocation {
01535     # userID, setID, and locationID can be undefined if being called from this package
01536     my $U = caller eq __PACKAGE__ ? "!" : "";
01537     my ($self, $userID, $setID, $locationID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, "user_id$U", "set_id$U", "set_locations_id$U");
01538     return $self->{set_locations_user}->delete($userID,$setID,$locationID);
01539 }
01540 
01541 ################################################################################
01542 # set_locations_merged functions
01543 ################################################################################
01544 # this is different from other set_merged functions, because
01545 #    in this case the only data that we have are the set_id,
01546 #    location_id, and user_id, and we want to replace all 
01547 #    locations from GlobalSetLocations with those from 
01548 #    UserSetLocations if the latter exist.
01549 
01550 sub getAllMergedSetLocations {
01551     my ($self, $userID, $setID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id set_id/);
01552 
01553     if ( $self->countUserSetLocations($userID, $setID) ) {
01554         return $self->getAllUserSetLocations( $userID, $setID );
01555     } else {
01556         return $self->getAllGlobalSetLocations( $setID );
01557     }
01558 }
01559

01695     return $self->{problem_user}->get_records_where($where);
01696 }
01697 
01698 sub addUserProblem {
01699     # VERSIONING - accept versioned ID fields
01700     my ($self, $UserProblem) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/VREC:problem_user/);
01701     
01702     croak "addUserProblem: user set ", $UserProblem->set_id, " for user ", $UserProblem->user_id, " not found"
01703         unless $self->{set_user}->exists($UserProblem->user_id, $UserProblem->set_id);
01704 
01705     my ( $nv_set_id, $versionNum ) = grok_vsetID( $UserProblem->set_id );
01706 
01707     croak "addUserProblem: problem ", $UserProblem->problem_id, " in set $nv_set_id not found"
01708         unless $self->{problem}->exists($nv_set_id, $UserProblem->problem_id);
01709     
01710     eval {
01711         return $self->{problem_user}->add($UserProblem);
01712     };
01713     if (my $ex = caught WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordExists) {
01714         croak "addUserProblem: user problem exists (perhaps you meant to use putUserProblem?)";
01715     } elsif ($@) {
01716         die $@;
01717     }
01718 }
01719 
01720 # versioned_ok is an optional argument which lets us slip versioned setIDs through checkArgs.
01721 sub putUserProblem {
01722     my $V = $_[2] ? "V" : "";
01723     my ($self, $UserProblem, undef) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, "${V}REC:problem_user", "versioned_ok!?");
01724     
01725     my $rows = $self->{problem_user}->put($UserProblem); # DBI returns 0E0 for 0.
01726     if ($rows == 0) {
01727         croak "putUserProblem: user problem not found (perhaps you meant to use addUserProblem?)";
01728     } else {
01729         return $rows;
01730     }
01731 }
01732 
01733 sub deleteUserProblem {
01734     # userID, setID, and problemID can be undefined if being called from this package
01735     my $U = caller eq __PACKAGE__ ? "!" : "";
01736     my ($self, $userID, $setID, $problemID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, "user_id$U", "set_id$U", "problem_id$U");
01737     return $self->{problem_user}->delete($userID, $setID, $problemID);
01738 }

01787 # versioned analog of countUserProblems
01788 sub countProblemVersions { return scalar shift->listProblemVersions(@_) }

01790 # versioned analog of listUserProblems
01791 sub listProblemVersions { 
01792     my ($self, $userID, $setID, $versionID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/user_id set_id version_id/);
01793     my $where = [user_id_eq_set_id_eq_version_id_eq => $userID,$setID,$versionID];
01794     if (wantarray) {
01795         return map { @$_ } $self->{problem_version}->get_fields_where(["problem_id"], $where);
01796     } else {
01797         return $self->{problem_version}->count_where($where);
01798     }
01799 }

01841 # versioned analog of addUserProblem
01842 sub addProblemVersion {
01843     my ($self, $ProblemVersion) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:problem_version/);
01844     
01845     croak "addProblemVersion: set version ", $ProblemVersion->version_id, " of set ", $ProblemVersion->set_id, " not found for user ", $ProblemVersion->user_id
01846         unless $self->{set_version}->exists($ProblemVersion->user_id, $ProblemVersion->set_id, $ProblemVersion->version_id);
01847     croak "addProblemVersion: problem ", $ProblemVersion->problem_id, " of set ", $ProblemVersion->set_id, " not found for user ", $ProblemVersion->user_id
01848         unless $self->{problem_user}->exists($ProblemVersion->user_id, $ProblemVersion->set_id, $ProblemVersion->problem_id);
01849     
01850     eval {
01851         return $self->{problem_version}->add($ProblemVersion);
01852     };
01853     if (my $ex = caught WeBWorK::DB::Ex::RecordExists) {
01854         croak "addProblemVersion: problem version exists (perhaps you meant to use putProblemVersion?)";
01855     } elsif ($@) {
01856         die $@;
01857     }
01858 }
01859 
01860 # versioned analog of putUserProblem
01861 sub putProblemVersion {
01862     my ($self, $ProblemVersion) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, qw/REC:problem_version/);
01863     my $rows = $self->{problem_version}->put($ProblemVersion); # DBI returns 0E0 for 0.
01864     if ($rows == 0) {
01865         croak "putProblemVersion: problem version not found (perhaps you meant to use addProblemVersion?)";
01866     } else {
01867         return $rows;
01868     }
01869 }
01870 
01871 # versioned analog of deleteUserProblem
01872 sub deleteProblemVersion {
01873     # userID, setID, versionID, and problemID can be undefined if being called from this package
01874     my $U = caller eq __PACKAGE__ ? "!" : "";
01875     my ($self, $userID, $setID, $versionID, $problemID) = shift->checkArgs(\@_, "user_id$U", "set_id$U", "version_id$U", "problem_id$U");
01876     return $self->{problem_version}->delete($userID, $setID, $versionID, $problemID);
01877 }

01914 ################################################################################
01915 # utilities
01916 ################################################################################
01917 
01918 sub check_user_id { #  (valid characters are [-a-zA-Z0-9_.,@]) 
01919     my $value = shift;
01920     if ($value =~ m/^[-a-zA-Z0-9_.@]*,?(set_id:)?[-a-zA-Z0-9_.@]*(,g)?$/ ) {
01921         return 1;
01922     } else {
01923         croak "invalid characters in user_id field: '$value' (valid characters are [-a-zA-Z0-9_.,@])";
01924         return 0;
01925     }
01926 }
01927 # the (optional) second argument to checkKeyfields is to support versioned
01928 # (gateway) sets, which may include commas in certain fields (in particular,
01929 # set names (e.g., setDerivativeGateway,v1) and user names (e.g., 
01930 # username,proctorname)
01931 
01932 sub checkKeyfields($;$) {
01933     my ($Record, $versioned) = @_;
01934     foreach my $keyfield ($Record->KEYFIELDS) {
01935         my $value = $Record->$keyfield;
01936         
01937         croak "undefined '$keyfield' field"
01938             unless defined $value;
01939         croak "empty '$keyfield' field"
01940             unless $value ne "";
01941         
01942         if ($keyfield eq "problem_id") {
01943             croak "invalid characters in '$keyfield' field: '$value' (valid characters are [0-9])"
01944                 unless $value =~ m/^[0-9]*$/;
01945         } elsif ($versioned and $keyfield eq "set_id") {
01946             croak "invalid characters in '$keyfield' field: '$value' (valid characters are [-a-zA-Z0-9_.,])"
01947                 unless $value =~ m/^[-a-zA-Z0-9_.,]*$/;
01948         # } elsif ($versioned and $keyfield eq "user_id") { 
01949         } elsif ($keyfield eq "user_id") { 
01950             check_user_id($value); #  (valid characters are [-a-zA-Z0-9_.,]) see above.
01951         } elsif ($keyfield eq "ip_mask") {
01952             croak "invalid characters in '$keyfield' field: '$value' (valid characters are [-a-fA-F0-9_.:/])"
01953                 unless $value =~ m/^[-a-fA-F0-9_.:\/]*$/;
01954                 
01955         } else {
01956             croak "invalid characters in '$keyfield' field: '$value' (valid characters are [-a-zA-Z0-9_.])"
01957                 unless $value =~ m/^[-a-zA-Z0-9_.]*$/;
01958         }
01959     }
01960 }
01961 
01962 
01963 # checkArgs spec syntax:
01964 # 
01965 # spec = list_item | item*
01966 # list_item = item is_list
01967 # is_list = "*"
01968 # item = item_name undef_ok? optional?
01969 # item_name = record_item | bare_item
01970 # record_item = is_versioned? "REC:" table
01971 # is_versioned = "V"
01972 # table = \w+
01973 # bare_item = \w+
01974 # undef_ok = "!"
01975 # optional = "?"
01976 # 
01977 # [[V]REC:]foo[!][?][*]
01978 
01979 sub checkArgs {
01980     my ($self, $args, @spec) = @_;
01981     
01982     my $is_list = @spec == 1 && $spec[0] =~ s/\*$//;
01983     my ($min_args, $max_args);
01984     if ($is_list) {
01985         $min_args = 0;
01986     } else {
01987         foreach my $i (0..$#spec) {
01988             #print "$i - $spec[$i]\n";
01989             if ($spec[$i] =~ s/\?$//) {
01990                 #print "$i - matched\n";
01991                 $min_args = $i unless defined $min_args;
01992             }
01993         }
01994         $min_args = @spec unless defined $min_args;
01995         $max_args = @spec;
01996     }
01997     
01998     if (@$args < $min_args or defined $max_args and @$args > $max_args) {
01999         if ($min_args == $max_args) {
02000             my $s = $min_args == 1 ? "" : "s";
02001             croak "requires $min_args argument$s";
02002         } elsif (defined $max_args) {
02003             croak "requires between $min_args and $max_args arguments";
02004         } else {
02005             my $s = $min_args == 1 ? "" : "s";
02006             croak "requires at least $min_args argument$s";
02007         }
02008     }
02009     
02010     my ($name, $versioned, $table);
02011     if ($is_list) {
02012         $name = $spec[0];
02013         ($versioned, $table) = $name =~ /^(V?)REC:(.*)/;
02014     }
02015     
02016     foreach my $i (0..@$args-1) {
02017         my $arg = $args->[$i];
02018         my $pos = $i+1;
02019         
02020         unless ($is_list) {
02021             $name = $spec[$i];
02022             ($versioned, $table) = $name =~ /^(V?)REC:(.*)/;
02023         }
02024         
02025         if (defined $table) {
02026             my $class = $self->{$table}{record};
02027             #print "arg=$arg class=$class\n";
02028             croak "argument $pos must be of type $class"
02029                 unless defined $arg and ref $arg and $arg->isa($class);
02030             eval { checkKeyfields($arg, $versioned) };
02031             croak "argument $pos contains $@" if $@;
02032         } else {
02033             if ($name !~ /!$/) {
02034                 croak "argument $pos must contain a $name"
02035                     unless defined $arg;
02036             }
02037         }
02038     }
02039     
02040     return $self, @$args;
02041 }
02042 
02043 sub checkArgsRefList {
02044     my ($self, $items, @spec) = @_;
02045     foreach my $i (0..@$items-1) {
02046         my $item = $items->[$i];
02047         my $pos = $i+1;
02048         croak "item $pos must be a reference to an array"
02049             unless UNIVERSAL::isa($item, "ARRAY");
02050         eval { $self->checkArgs($item, @spec) };
02051         croak "item $pos $@" if $@;
02052     }
02053     
02054     return $self, @$items;
02055 }
